alert.note: Alert for Hays (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 20 at 10:43PM CDT until April 21 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM CDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Blanco, Comal, Hays and Kendall. * WHEN...Until 200 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1043 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wimberley, Canyon Lake Dam, Canyon Lake, Bulverde, Fischer, Spring Branch, Twin Sisters, Smithson Valley, Guadalupe River State Park, Kendalia, Startzville, Sattler and Honey Creek State Natural Area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
